title: Problems with newest release
body:
I decided to update to the v1.20 version as I needed to use the inverse depth maps feature that was recently added . 

This in turn brought some problems:

The first one was that [this line in the scenario.py](https://github.com/BeamNG/BeamNGpy/blob/e0f2e648f044137a92f77f1e272dfcf851fc7ad9/src/beamngpy/scenario.py#L577) caused a KeyError. 
I assume the dictionary to check was called "cameras" so I updated it in #131 


The second and more important issue is that vehicle.poll_sensors() broke.
The method blocks and never receives a socket response from the engine. 
The console returns the  following exception whenever the sensors are polled:

```
022.947|E|GameEngineLua:Exception|[string "lua/ge/extensions//util/researchGE.lua"]:583: bad argument #3 to 'renderCameraShmem' (string expected, got boolean)
=============== Stack Traceback >> START >>
(1)  C function 'function: 0x015f20ddad10'
(2) field C function 'renderCameraShmem'
(3) Lua upvalue 'frameDelayFunc' at line 583 of chunk 'lua/ge/extensions//util/researchGE.lua'
  Local variables:
  otherData = nil
(4) Lua local 'funcListElement' at line 107 of chunk 'lua/ge/extensions//util/researchGE.lua'
  Local variables:
  dt = number: 0.0430973
(5) Lua field 'hook' at line 635 of chunk 'lua/common/extensions.lua'
  Local variables:
  func = string: "onPreRender"
  funcList = table: 0x015f20d80d78  {1:function: 0x015f21234ca8, 2:function: 0x015f5fff7300, 3:function: 0x015f2100c000 (more...)}
  (for index) = number: 1
  (for limit) = number: 10
  (for step) = number: 1
  i = number: 1
  funcListElement = Lua function '?' (defined at line 99 of chunk lua/ge/extensions//util/researchGE.lua)
  extCallName = nil
(6) Lua function 'luaPreRender' at file 'lua/ge/main.lua:299' (best guess)
  Local variables:
  dtReal = number: 0.0430973
  dtSim = number: 0.04175
  dtRaw = number: 0.0809019
  updateUIData = boolean: true
--------------- << END <<

```


Do you by any chance know what could be going on when trying to read the sensors. I'm only  using the cameras 


Edit: I downgraded to version 1.19 for the time being and it works without an issue.
